column4: here is the output of mount:  /dev/sde1 on /media/IOMEGA_HD1 type vfat (rw,noexec,nosuid,nodev,quiet,shortname=winnt,uid=1000,gid=1000,umask=077,iocharset=utf8)
what user does it say the USB Drive belongs to?
is it the one in the above mount output? isn't it?
Ive got a feeling I know why.
I thought maybe it was set to root, as ubuntu doesnt use root, it would make much sense to have it 777
do you think i can set it up in fstab or will it conflict with hal?
you can fix it though by typing chmod 777 [path to mounted drive]
